UAVariable.Description: The Active variable is TRUE if this particular protective function is active, i.e. that a stop or slowdown is initiated, FALSE otherwise. If Enabled is FALSE then Active shall be FALSE.

The Enabled variable is TRUE if this protective function is currently supervising the system, FALSE otherwise. A protective function may or may not be enabled at all times, e.g. the protective stop function of the safety doors are typically enabled in automatic operational mode and disabled in manual mode.
The Name of the ProtectiveStopFunctionType provides a manufacturer-specific protective function identifier within the safety system.
Stop enabled for direction where position value increases (plus).
Stop enabled for direction where position value decreases (minus).
This property describes which is the mode of operation for this protective function, for example force limiter for overload protection devices or motion limiter for limit switches etc.
Speed limitation request written from client, in direction where position value increases, in percentage of rated speed, range [0%..100%]
Speed limitation request written from client, in direction where position value decreases, in percentage of rated speed, range [0%..100%]

Speed limitation request active, written from client, in direction where position value increases. True if a client requests the speed to be limited in this direction, false if speed doesn't need to be limited.

Speed limitation request active, written from client, in direction where position value decreases. True if a client requests the speed to be limited in this direction, false if speed doesn't need to be limited.
Speed limitation value active on the control system, in direction where position value increases, in percentage of rated speed, range [0%..100%]
Speed limitation value active on the control system, in direction where position value decreases, in percentage of rated speed, range [0%..100%]
True when the Axis is moving, false if not.
Indicates if the motion is slowed down or stopped gracefully with ramping down instead of with brakes.
Stop enabled for direction where position value decreases (minus).
Stop enabled for direction where position value increases (plus).

Field.Name: OTHER
Field.Description: Use if vendor specific

Field.Name: MANUAL
Field.Description: Crane is operated manually by a human operator

Field.Name: SEMIAUTOMATIC
Field.Description: Some or all of crane motions are automated, but a human operator is required in the loop.

Field.Name: FULLAUTOMATIC
Field.Description: All of the crane motions are automated. No human intervention is required.

Field.Name: BYPASS_ON
Field.Description: A function, such as an assistive feature, is bypassed on the crane, e. g. to continue productive work in case a non-critical function suffers a fault.

Field.Name: MAINTENANCE
Field.Description: Crane is in maintenance mode, typically operating at reduced speed and possibly with some protective functions disabled so they will not hinder or prohibit service activities.

uax:Description.uax:Text: Use if vendor specific
Crane is operated manually by a human operator
Some or all of crane motions are automated, but a human operator is required in the loop.
All of the crane motions are automated. No human intervention is required.
A function, such as an assistive feature, is bypassed on the crane, e. g. to continue productive work in case a non-critical function suffers a fault.
Crane is in maintenance mode, typically operating at reduced speed and possibly with some protective functions disabled so they will not hinder or prohibit service activities.

Field.Name: NOT_REQUESTED
Field.Description: No control request inputs have been received from any client

Field.Name: REQUESTED_AND_CONTROL_ACTIVE
Field.Description: Control request input has been received from a client and the request is being applied to the control

Field.Name: REQUESTED_AND_CONTROL_INACTIVE
Field.Description: Control request input has been received from a client but the request is not currently being applied to the control

Field.Name: REQUESTED_AND_CONTROL_BYPASSED
Field.Description: Control request input has been received from a client but the request is not currently being applied to the control because it has been bypassed in the control system

uax:Description.uax:Text: No control request inputs have been received from any client
Control request input has been received from a client and the request is being applied to the control
Control request input has been received from a client but the request is not currently being applied to the control
Control request input has been received from a client but the request is not currently being applied to the control because it has been bypassed in the control system

Field.Name: OTHER
Field.Description: Use if vendor specific

Field.Name: FORCE_LIMITER
Field.Description: Limiting the transmitted force

Field.Name: OVERSPEED_CONTROL
Field.Description: Limiting the speed during operation

Field.Name: MOTION_LIMITER
Field.Description: Limiting by stopping motion

Field.Name: ANTICOLLISION
Field.Description: Device with the ability to bring the moving crane or trolley(s) to a stop before a collision occurs

uax:Description.uax:Text: Use if vendor specific
Limiting the transmitted force
Limiting the speed during operation
Limiting by stopping motion
Device with the ability to bring the moving crane or trolley(s) to a stop before a collision occurs

UAVariable.Description: The lowest ISO 12482 designed working period (DWP) of this component. Percentage, initial value: 100.0%

UAObject.Description: Axes is a container for one or more instances of the AxisType.

Field.Name: HOIST
Field.Description: Hoisting machinery

Field.Name: TROLLEY_TRAVERSE
Field.Description: Trolley traverse or cross travel machinery

Field.Name: BRIDGE_OR_GANTRY_TRAVEL
Field.Description: Bridge or gantry travel, long travel machinery

Field.Name: LOAD_LIFTING_ATTACHMENT
Field.Description: Load lifting attachment

Field.Name: ROTATING_OR_SLEWING
Field.Description: Rotating or slewing machinery

Field.Name: LUFFING
Field.Description: Luffing machinery

Field.Name: POWER_SUPPLY_MACHINERY
Field.Description: Power supply or power delivery

Field.Name: OTHER
Field.Description: Other

uax:Description.uax:Text: Hoisting machinery
Trolley traverse or cross travel machinery
Bridge or gantry travel, long travel machinery
Load lifting attachment
Rotating or slewing machinery
Luffing machinery
Power supply or power delivery
Other

UAVariable.Description: This property describes which category this motion device belongs to. Different categories include hoists, trolley traversing machineries, bridge or gantry travelling machineries, load lifting attachments etc.

uax:Description.uax:Text: The axis moves at rated speed.
The axis moves above the rated speed when load is under certain percentage of rated load. This function reduces the load cycle time and can be used for hoisting.

Microspeed turns large joystick movements on the operator interface into slow and exact load movements. This function assists in very accurate and precise load handling and reduces the risk of collision and can be used for hoisting and travelling.

Inching is designed to ensure accurate final load positioning by allowing the crane operator to move the load in small increments. This function assists in very accurate and precise load handling and reduces the risk of collision and can be used for hoisting and travelling.

This function limits load swing by controlling the bridge and trolley acceleration and deceleration. Antisway allows faster load handling and more precise positioning. This feature also reduces the risk of damage to the load, crane and surrounding area.

Two or more hoists are operated from a single control station for handling of a single load. Two or more load lifting attachments’/hooks’ positions are synchronized. This function gives more accuracy when two or more hoists are used at the same time. Hoisting speeds are the same within the tolerances required for the particular application.
Two or more trolleys are operated from a single control station for handling of a single load. Horizontal speeds are the same within the tolerances required for the particular application.

This function allows the operator to control two cranes at the same time from one control station. The operator controls two cranes as one. This feature is useful when the operator needs to handle a single load with two cranes.
This function allows the operator to move the crane to a predefined position without effort. With a single operator input, the crane carries out the sequence to reach the selected destination.
